A **horned devil**, &, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The horned devil is a form of [demon](/wiki/Demon_\(monster_class\) "Demon (monster class)") that is [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned"), has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), can be seen via infravision, and can follow the [player](/wiki/Player "Player") character to other levels if they are adjacent.

A horned devil has a weapon attack, a claw attack, a bite attack, and a sting attack. Like all [major demons](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon"), they possess [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") and [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

Horned devils are [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to consume, which primarily comes up if they are [digested](/wiki/Digest "Digest") by another monster.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [4.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Horned devils are not randomly generated, and normally-created ones are always hostile. The horned devil technically only appears in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), but [cannot be randomly generated there](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency") since it is [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful"). This also occurs with [barbed devils](/wiki/Barbed_devil "Barbed devil") and the [erinys](/wiki/Erinys "Erinys").

Horned devils may be generated in [graveyards](/wiki/Graveyard "Graveyard"), and [the lairs of Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus%27_Lair "Asmodeus' Lair") [and Baalzebub](/wiki/Baalzebub%27s_Lair "Baalzebub's Lair") will each contain a horned devil upon normal level creation.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) A horned devil appears within [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum"), placed just outside the temple near its southeast corner.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

Horned devils can be summoned via the [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Horned devils may also appear as [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion") of chaotic gods and [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch").

A horned devil is [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") either a [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident") (3⁄4 chance) or a [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip") (1⁄4 chance).[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Strategy

The horned devil is among the weakest of the major demons, with lower [monster difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") and hit die but better [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") than the barbed devil. They also have a lower difficulty than the [water demon](/wiki/Water_demon "Water demon"), who has an AC closer to the horned devil's but also possesses weaker hit die; this is likely because the water demon is faster and can swim.

Horned devils are slower than an unhasted player, and a [fast](/wiki/Fast "Fast") well-armored character with a well-enchanted blessed and/or silver weapon will have relatively little trouble dispatching one - a [wand](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold") or [cone of cold](/wiki/Cone_of_cold "Cone of cold") can usually eliminate them in one or two shots. However, they can still pose a significant threat if they disarm you with their bullwhip, which [speedrunners](/wiki/Speed_ascension "Speed ascension") in particular will find a major nuisance - having [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur") yanked out of your hand, e.g. in the middle of a pitched fight against [Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus") or [Baalzebub](/wiki/Baalzebub "Baalzebub"), can be fatal. Like other demons, they can also be an unwelcome surprise from [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph"), such as monsters stepping on [polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap").

Horned devils are a decent source of tridents and bullwhips for those looking to utilize either.

## History

The horned devil is introduced in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

In the restructured [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom_\(Lethe_patch\) "Gehennom (Lethe patch)") featured within the [Lethe patch](/wiki/Lethe_patch "Lethe patch"), Baalzebub's lair contains 5 horned devils.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), chaotic characters have a chance of receiving a horned devil as a tame minion from sacrificing while at any [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") from 10 to 16.

Four horned devils appear in [the newly-added lair of](/wiki/Dispater%27s_lair_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dispater's lair (SLASH'EM)") [Dispater](/wiki/Dispater "Dispater"). There is also a 1⁄10 chance that a [lemure pit](/wiki/Lemure_pit "Lemure pit") [special room](/wiki/Special_room_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Special room (SLASH'EM)") may contain a horned devil among the lemures at level creation.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), there is a 1⁄10 chance of the lemure pit [special room](/wiki/Special_room_\(UnNetHack\) "Special room (UnNetHack)") containing a horned devil, as in SLASH'EM.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), horned devils are given a passive quill attack.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [The Idol of Moloch](/wiki/The_Idol_of_Moloch "The Idol of Moloch") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [figurine](/wiki/Figurine "Figurine") of a horned devil and the [Infidel](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"): It can be applied like a normal figurine to summon a random major demon, including a horned devil, without using up the artifact. This also applies to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

## Encyclopedia entry

These devils lack any real special abilities, though they are quite difficult to kill.

## References

A horned devil, &, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. The horned devil is a form of demon that is thick-skinned, has infravision, can be seen via infravision, and can follow the player character to other levels if they are adjacent.

A horned devil has a weapon attack, a claw attack, a bite attack, and a sting attack. Like all major demons, they possess fire resistance and poison resistance.

Horned devils are poisonous to consume, which primarily comes up if they are digested by another monster.

Horned devils may be generated in graveyards, and the lairs of Asmodeus and Baalzebub will each contain a horned devil upon normal level creation.[1][2] A horned devil appears within Moloch's Sanctum, placed just outside the temple near its southeast corner.[3]

Horned devils can be summoned via the summon nasties monster spell.[4] Horned devils may also appear as minions of chaotic gods and Moloch.

A horned devil is generated with either a trident (3⁄4 chance) or a bullwhip (1⁄4 chance).[5]

The horned devil is among the weakest of the major demons, with lower monster difficulty and hit die but better AC than the barbed devil. They also have a lower difficulty than the water demon, who has an AC closer to the horned devil's but also possesses weaker hit die; this is likely because the water demon is faster and can swim.

Four horned devils appear in the newly-added lair of Dispater. There is also a 1⁄10 chance that a lemure pit special room may contain a horned devil among the lemures at level creation.
